New play and informal recreation facilities should be designed to meet the needs of Tower Hamletsâ€™ population, be inclusive, accessible, and safe, through: a. co-design with local adults, children and young people, parents, and carers on the design of new provision early on in the development of an application; and BIODIVERSITY AND OPEN SPACE b. designing play and informal recreation facilities which are exciting and engaging for all abilities and ages. Facilities should be well-designed, secure, and free to use. They should provide for a range of interests and address barriers to play by tackling issues of inclusion and equity; and reduce the harm caused by poor air quality through the favourable location of play and informal recreation facilities to minimise exposure to pollutants and careful layout and choice of soft landscaping. c. ensuring play space is accessible from surrounding all public spaces; enabling a range of users.
